description._content: Description: Boat Kutari having Springlands to go up Courantyne with Metford and Smith etc. and 4 NCOs. Location: Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: R Courantyne near Springlands. Dark part on left bottom corner is part of aeroplane not bank of river which is 10 miles wide. Location: Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: Schooner Blossom unloading Commission on Carrington Smiths partly finished jetty at Hepsiba. Location: Hepsiba, Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: R Courantyne near No.63. Village at mouth. Location: Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: Hepsiba Depot. R. Courantyne. Canes in foreground are all petrol for boats. 10 galls. each case. Location: Hebsiba, Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: Hepsiba Depot from the air showing jetty built by Smith. Location: Hebsiba, Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Our Catalogue Reference: Part of CO 1069/365 This image is part of the Colonial Office photographic collection held at The National Archives, uploaded as part of the Caribbean Through a Lens project. We have attempted to provide place information for the images automatically but our software may not have found the correct location. We need your help to fill in the gaps, to unearth the missing stories, the social and cultural memories from this selection of colonial recordings. Do you recognise anything or anyone in the photographs? Do they provoke any personal or historical memories? If so, please leave your comments, tags and stories to enrich our records. If you would like to get involved in our community project Caribbean through a lens, we would love to hear from you. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library
